title: While Chanting Krishna Is Before Us as His Nama | Sri Madhu Pandit Dasa | ISKCON Bangalore Sanga
speaker: HG Madhu Pandit Dasa

segments.key_quote: Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
segments.summary: The lecture begins with prayers and mantras, including the Hare Krishna Mahamantra.

segments.key_quote: Day and night we are interacting with the limited.
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts our daily interactions with limited things and people with the unlimited nature of Krishna.

segments.key_quote: Japa is a meeting of the limited person we with the unlimited person.
segments.summary: Japa is presented as a meeting between the limited self and the unlimited Krishna, a completely different kind of interaction.

segments.key_quote: God is before you as soon as you chant Krishna.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes that Krishna, the limitless and infinite, is present in the form of His name, especially in Kali Yuga.

segments.key_quote: If you don't have Shraddha when you are chanting, then it becomes mechanical.
segments.summary: The importance of faith (Shraddha) during chanting is highlighted, explaining that without it, chanting becomes a mere mechanical exercise, and the Lord's presence isn't felt.

segments.key_quote: The biggest secret is to always remember Krishna, Man Mana Bhava Madbhakto.
segments.summary: Because our spiritual senses are dormant, Krishna appears in the sound of the mantra, allowing us to serve Him with our senses and consciousness, fulfilling the essence of 'Man Mana Bhava Madbhakto'.

segments.key_quote: Wherever my mind goes I go, so if my mind goes on Hare Krishna... I am also taken there.
segments.summary: Hearing the mantra is crucial because the mind tends to wander; by focusing the mind on the sound of Krishna's name, one is transported to Krishna.

segments.key_quote: There is no difference between Krishna and Krishnanama.
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts the limited results of karma with the unlimited potential of japa, emphasizing that Krishna's name possesses all of Krishna's qualities and is non-different from Him.

segments.key_quote: Everything good and bad materially measured is all gift from Krishna, everything is prasadam for Vaishnava beyond karma.
segments.summary: With Shraddha, feelings like Preeti (love) and gratitude arise, recognizing that everything in life is a gift from Krishna, transcending karma.

segments.key_quote: When you are before me on my tongue, my mind has traveled ignoring you into so many other things, limited things.
segments.summary: The speaker encourages begging forgiveness for offenses committed during chanting, particularly for allowing the mind to wander to limited things instead of focusing on the unlimited Krishna.

segments.key_quote: It is not an limited to limited interaction but it is a limited to unlimited interaction.
segments.summary: The lecture concludes by reiterating that japa is a relationship with the unlimited, emphasizing the importance of understanding this during chanting.
